definitions: Burned or scorched the surface of something with a sudden, intense heat.
Cooked the surface of food quickly with intense heat to form a crust.
Caused to feel a sudden, intense, and painful burning sensation.
Had a sudden, powerful, and unpleasant effect on someone's feelings or memory.
examples: The hot iron seared his skin.
The image of the accident seared into her memory.
The sun seared the dry earth.
